### Solution {.tabset}

#### R

```{r}
fun <- function(x){
  return(sin(sqrt(x)))
}

X <- rlnorm(1000, meanlog=0, sdlog=1)

```

```{r collapse=TRUE, echo=FALSE}
cat("mean of X: ", mean(X), "\n")
cat("mean of f(X): ", mean(fun(X)), "\n")
cat("f(mean of X): ", fun(mean(X)), "\n")
cat("variance of X:", var(X), "\n")
cat("variance of f(X):", var(fun(X)), "\n")

X <- sort(X)
```

```{r plot_X}
plot(X,fun(X))
hist(X)
hist(fun(X))

```

#### Julia
```{julia, results = 'hide'}
function f(x)
    return sin.(sqrt.(x))
end
```

```{julia, results = 'hide'}
log_norm_X = LogNormal()
log_norm_X_s = rand(log_norm_X, 1000)
```

```{julia}
#mean of X
Statistics.mean(log_norm_X_s)
#mean of f(X)
Statistics.mean(f(log_norm_X_s))
#f(mean of X)
f(Statistics.mean(log_norm_X_s))
#variance of x
Statistics.var(log_norm_X_s)
#variance of f(X)
Statistics.var(f(log_norm_X_s))
```
Plotting
```{julia}
scatter(log_norm_X_s, f(log_norm_X_s),
    labels = false,
    xlabel = "X",
    ylabel = "f(X)")
histogram(log_norm_X_s, nbins=20,
    labels = false,
    xlabel = "X",
    ylabel = "Frenquency",
    title = "Histogram of X")
histogram(f(log_norm_X_s), nbins=20,
    labels = false,
    xlabel = "f(X)",
    ylabel = "Frenquency",
    title = "Histogram of f(X)")
```
